Hi! Sorry that first answer is a little bit confusing about preset pages -
The preset pages mentioned are NOT pages that count towards your page total AT ALL. Eventually we're going to give you the option to even hide these pages in your inventory if you don't want to see them, since they're not intended to work like other pages.
Preset pages should give players who don't want to spend a lot of time thinking about or agonizing over rune choices a good general page per Path. They also serve as our fallback in game - if everything goes wrong, you should still at the very least end up with a full page in your game (no more completely missing keystones). Thus, if you're playing a tanky champion and take the Resolve preset page you can be assured you're going in with some good generalist options you don't need to worry too much about.
We want players to explore runes at their own pace and assume that most folks will want to make their own custom pages, so the intent with preset pages is not to homogenize every Resolve page (after all, we're providing generalist options in the preset pages, there are probably better ones for specific champions).
TL;DR Preset pages are in ADDITION to your usual custom rune pages. They DO NOT count towards your page total at all, and they're there for a different purpose than normal, custom rune pages.
